intro: Hieracium × tomosenze, commonly known as the hybrid groundsel, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its daisy-like flowers, which typically feature yellow centers surrounded by white or pale pink ray florets. The plant produces a basal rosette of leaves that are usually hairy and serrated, with a rough texture. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions and full sun to partial shade. Hieracium × tomosenze is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides, meadows, and gardens.
